revised_title: Respiratory Adaptations and Evolution in Pupae of Beetles of the Family Psephenidae
tldr: The author examines the respiratory adaptations of beetle pupae in the Psephenidae family, focusing on the development of spiracular gills and plastron respiration. They discuss the unique unstable environment these beetles inhabit and the various respiratory adaptations they have evolved. The study also explores the irreversible evolution of respiratory systems and the persistence of non-functional structures in these beetles.
